page.title: 17PARACHUTING:NORTH/ELTON
page.content: Since opening in 1971 at Sibson aero- drome over 17,000 people have made be- tween them 170,000 descents. The centre has about 100 members who use two Britten-Norman Islander aircraft with a capacity for 17 jumpers. Two-day courses are run costing about Â£77 depending on time of year. Accommodation and facilities for camp- ing and caravans are available. Course consists of 10 hours intensive ground training including five periods of landing practice using swing and fan trainers. The club is the only civilian one to use fan trainers, both vertical and horizontal, the latter proving to give most realistic landing. Course includes one jump from an aircraft. Most of the parachute jumps are made for charity.
